intro: Eragrostis minor var. rajasthanensis, commonly known as the Rajasthan grass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of India. It is a short-lived perennial grass that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown florets. It is well adapted to drought conditions and thrives in sandy or loamy soils. This species is often used for soil stabilization and as a forage plant in dryland agriculture.
